page.title: 17TOURISM IN THE HARVEL AREA
page.content: Tourism in our area is a gentle pastime often going unnoticed by local inhabitants. Some people, en route, stop to admire the duck pond or lambs in the fields, while others come intentionally to walk some of the many footpaths scattered across the area or to see the bluebells which carpet the woodlands in spring. Our pretty country lanes provide interesting riding for cyclists, and horse lovers too have their bridlepaths. Nature ramblers and bird watchers find a wealth of plant, animal and bird life and the escarpment at Holly Hill, with its view over the Weald of Kent, is ideal for those who come to sit and stare. Even winter finds visitors coming to toboggan down the escarpment or look upon the hedgerows, trees and fields cloaked in a mantle of snow.
